measure.name: process_cooling_setpoints
measure.display_name: Set Residential Cooling Setpoints and Schedules
measure.description: This measure creates the cooling season schedules and the cooling setpoint schedules. See https://github.com/NREL/OpenStudio-BuildStock#workflows for supported workflows using this measure.
measure.modeler_description: This measure creates res cooling season ruleset objects. Schedule values are either user-defined or populated based on information contained in the EPW file. This measure also creates res cooling setpoint ruleset objects. Schedule values are populated based on information input by the user as well as contained in the res cooling season. The cooling setpoint schedules are added to the living zone's thermostat. The cooling setpoint schedule is constructed by taking the base setpoint (or 24-hour comma-separated cooling schedule) and applying an optional offset, as specified by the offset magnitude and offset schedule. If specified as a 24-hour schedule, the base setpoint can incorporate setpoint schedule changes, but having a separately specified offset magnitude and schedule is convenient for parametric runs.

argument.name: weekday_setpoint
argument.description: Specify a single cooling setpoint or a 24-hour comma-separated cooling schedule for the weekdays.

argument.name: weekend_setpoint
argument.description: Specify a single cooling setpoint or a 24-hour comma-separated cooling schedule for the weekend.

argument.name: weekday_offset_magnitude
argument.description: Specify the magnitude of the cooling setpoint offset for the weekdays, which will be applied during hours specified by the offset schedule. A positive offset increases the setpoint while a negative offset decreases the setpoint.

argument.name: weekend_offset_magnitude
argument.description: Specify the magnitude of the cooling setpoint offset for the weekdays, which will be applied during hours specified by the offset schedule. A positive offset increases the setpoint while a negative offset decreases the setpoint.

argument.name: weekday_offset_schedule
argument.description: Specify a 24-hour comma-separated schedule of 0s and 1s for applying the offset on weekdays.

argument.name: weekend_offset_schedule
argument.description: Specify a 24-hour comma-separated schedule of 0s and 1s for applying the offset on weekend.

argument.name: use_auto_season
argument.description: Specifies whether to automatically define the cooling season based on the weather file. If the cooling setpoint is less than the heating setpoint during the cooling-only season, the heating setpoint will be set to the cooling setpoint. If the cooling setpoint is less than the heating setpoint during the overlap season, the heating and cooling setpoints will be set to their average value. User-defined cooling season start/end months will be ignored if this is selected.

argument.name: season_start_month
argument.description: Start month of the cooling season.

argument.name: season_end_month
argument.description: End month of the cooling season.
